definition: to add interest (to a story)/to sex up
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning
to add/to increase/to replenish
vinegar/jealousy (in love rivalry)

sentences.english: Tell the truth; do not embellish the story.
sentences.chinese: 实话实说，不要加油添醋。

sentences.english: Don't add to the article I have written.
sentences.chinese: 别在我写完的文章上加油添醋。

definition: lit. to add oil and vinegar/fig. adding details while telling a story (to make it more interesting)
vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
variant of 原原本本[yuan2 yuan2 ben3 ben3]
(idiom) half true and half false
lit. count by fives and tens (idiom); to narrate systematically and in full detail
busybody
from beginning to end/in its entirety/in accord with fact/literal
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to concoct a cock-and-bull story (idiom)/to make things up
without missing a word
to make things up/to concoct (a story, an excuse etc)
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to speak without thinking/to blurt sth out
see 煞有介事[sha4 you3 jie4 shi4]
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
